intro: Exostyles godoyensis, commonly known as the Godoy's exostyle, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, pentagonal flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically ovate with serrated edges, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
